subject: Re: How to print string messages using JUNIT even if the test method is passing
msgSnippet: Thanks for all the help. I just needed that extra leverage which can make the test to generate log files that are user friendly and a person can understand
messageBody:
Thanks for all the help. I just needed that extra leverage which can
make the test to generate log files that are user friendly and a
person can understand whats going on in the tests without going
through the source code. I happened to get help from one of the
guys "Ilja Preu√ü's" and he has posted me a link regd. logging in
information. May be it will be of help for user with similar reqmnts.
http://www.openfuture.de/Log4Unit/


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> Anshumaan Rajshiva wrote:
>
> > I want to know a way by which i can dump useful information in a
test
> > case using JUNIT even if it is passing. Till now, all the assert
> > statements throws message only if the statement fails. I want to
know
> > is there a way to dump a message even if the assert statement
passes??
>
> You could just print to the console, or adding logging to your test
cases.
>
> One of the design philosophies behind JUnit is that, if all the
tests
> pass, we only care about seeing an "OK" or a green bar. We only
want
> information if tests fail. That is why, "out of the box", JUnit
does not
> provide information about passing tests.
>
> Take care.
